docs.snippet: The funding of the sprawling philanthropy has become an Achilles’ heel for Mrs. Clinton’s White House bid and, if she is victorious, potentially her administration as well....
docs.lead_paragraph: The funding of the sprawling philanthropy has become an Achilles’ heel for Mrs. Clinton’s White House bid and, if she is victorious, potentially her administration as well.
docs.abstract: Hundreds of millions of dollars given to Clinton Foundation by foreign donors has become liability for Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign, and may continue to be should she win presidency; at issue is Clinton's impartiality toward generous donors should she be elected president.

headline.main: Foundation Ties Bedevil Hillary Clinton’s Presidential Campaign

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and STEVE EDER

docs.snippet: How we helped politicians stop taking themselves so seriously, for better or worse....
docs.lead_paragraph: How we helped politicians stop taking themselves so seriously, for better or worse.
docs.abstract: Campaign Stops column by Tabitha Soren reflects on being political reporter for MTV News during 1990s; notes '90s nostalgia is everywhere, particularly apt trend given fact another Clinton is running for president; notes degree to which news media has moved in direction MTV News pioneered, even though MTV was mocked widely at time, and suggests MTV News inadvertantly helped turn politics into entertainment.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton and the Ghosts of MTV

docs.snippet: A review of the Republican presidential nominee’s holdings uncovered more debt than what is apparent on his federal election filing, and partnerships with even more liabilities....
docs.lead_paragraph: A review of the Republican presidential nominee’s holdings uncovered more debt than what is apparent on his federal election filing, and partnerships with even more liabilities.
docs.abstract: New York Times investigation reveals Donald J Trump's real estate ventures in United States have at least $650 million in debt, twice amount reflected in his public filings; inquiry also finds Trump's fortunes rely on array of financial backers, belying his image as wealthy man beholden to no one; much of Trump's business ventures remain cloaked in mystery, and he has declined to disclose his tax returns or allow an independent valuation of his assets.

headline.main: Trump’s Empire: A Maze of Debts and Opaque Ties
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Empire: A Maze of Debts and Opaque Ties

byline.contributor: David W. Chen contributed reporting, and Susan C. Beachy contributed research.

docs.snippet: Republican Sen. Johnny Isakson insists he won't be a "volunteer apologist" for Donald Trump or anyone else who utters something stupid, but that defiant independence is being sorely tested by the GOP presidential nominee's sinking support and Demo...
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican Sen. Johnny Isakson insists he won't be a "volunteer apologist" for Donald Trump or anyone else who utters something stupid, but that defiant independence is being sorely tested by the GOP presidential nominee's sinking support and Democrat Hillary Clinton's push into surprisingly competitive Georgia.

headline.main: Trump-Clinton Race Tests Senate Race in Reliably GOP Georgia
headline.print_headline: Trump-Clinton Race Tests Senate Race in Reliably GOP Georgia

docs.snippet: We seem unable to describe the candidate’s behavior without falling back on these three words....
docs.lead_paragraph: We seem unable to describe the candidate’s behavior without falling back on these three words.
docs.abstract: Loose Ends column by author Thomas Vinciguerra observes how many times news journalists and pundits have used phrase 'new low' in reporting on Donald Trump's behavior over course of presidential campaign.

headline.main: Trump’s New High of New Lows

docs.snippet: How the Christian right came to support the most openly profane Republican presidential nominee in a generation....
docs.lead_paragraph: How the Christian right came to support the most openly profane Republican presidential nominee in a generation.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Daniel K Williams underscores degree to which solid conservative white evangelical support for Donald Trump's candidacy is based on belief that he represents only chance to regain control of Supreme Court; warns evangelicals that they may be selling out their values in order to achieve victory on this single issue.

headline.main: Why Values Voters Value Donald Trump
headline.print_headline: Why Values Voters Value Donald Trump

docs.snippet: Who’s sorry now? Believe it or not, the Donald. He offers his apologia in an open letter....
docs.lead_paragraph: Who’s sorry now? Believe it or not, the Donald. He offers his apologia in an open letter.
docs.abstract: Maureen Dowd Op-Ed column pens imaginary open letter from Donald Trump in which he apologizes for fact that he is not sorry for offending everyone.

headline.main: An Open Letter From Mr. Trump

docs.snippet: His message resonates with voters who feel guns are all they have....
docs.lead_paragraph: His message resonates with voters who feel guns are all they have.
docs.abstract: Campaign Stops column by Daniel Hayes describes how his hometown of Middlesboro, Ky, has declined over past two decades and explains allure Donald Trump candidacy holds for many in area; notes while outsourcing and guns are twin issues animating most of Trump's supporters, many of them feel that fighting gun control is only issue in which they have political agency.

docs.snippet: Donald Trump's campaign expenses more than doubled last month, even as the Republican presidential nominee held his payroll to about 70 employees, aired no television advertisements and undertook no significant operational buildout across the coun...
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump's campaign expenses more than doubled last month, even as the Republican presidential nominee held his payroll to about 70 employees, aired no television advertisements and undertook no significant operational buildout across the country.

headline.main: Trump Campaign Doubles Spending, Not Ground Game
headline.print_headline: Trump Campaign Doubles Spending, Not Ground Game
